@graph.caption: Mongolian Beef recipe in a platter ready to be served.

@graph.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe - Spoon Fork Bacon
@graph.description: The most delicious Mongolian Beef Recipe made in under 30 minutes! Quick cooked tender beef coated in a slightly sweet and savory sauce.

@graph.name: Jenny Park
@graph.description: Jenny Park is half of Spoon Fork Bacon. She is also a food stylist and recipe developer. One of her favorite foods is donuts. #sfbJENNY

@graph.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe
@graph.description: The only Mongolian Beef Recipe you will ever need! A quick, easy and ridiculously delicious stir-fry dish of tender beef coated in a slightly sweet and savory sauce. Serve it over steamed rice to soak up all the saucy goodness!

video.name: Easy Mongolian Beef Recipe
video.description:
We love this Mongolian Beef recipe. It's a quick, easy and delicious stir-fry dish of tender beef coated in a slightly sweet and savory sauce. We love to serve it over steamed rice!

FULL RECIPE: https://www.spoonforkbacon.com/mongolian-beef-over-steamed-rice/

Did you make this recipe? 
We want to see! tag @SpoonForkBacon and #SpoonForkBacon on Instagram

INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/spoonforkbacon/

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/spoonforkbacon
PINTEREST: https://www.pinterest.com/spoonforkbacon/
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/spoonforkbacon

recipeIngredient: 2  New York Strip Steaks, thinly sliced (about 1 1/2 pounds)
⅓ cup low sodium soy sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Season sliced steak with salt and pepper. Toss steak in cornstarch until fully and evenly coated. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Season sliced steak with salt and pepper. Toss steak in cornstarch until fully and evenly coated. Set aside.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 1
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 1: Season sliced steak with salt and pepper. Toss steak in cornstarch until fully and evenly coated. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoons oil. Add garlic and ginger and saute for 1 minutes. Add soy sauce, water and sugar and bring to a boil until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoons oil. Add garlic and ginger and saute for 1 minutes. Add soy sauce, water and sugar and bring to a boil until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 2
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 2: Place a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoons oil. Add garlic and ginger and saute for 1 minutes. Add soy sauce, water and sugar and bring to a boil until sugar dissolves, about 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour sauce into a liquid measuring cup and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour sauce into a liquid measuring cup and set aside.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 3
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 3: Pour sauce into a liquid measuring cup and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Place skillet back over heat and add remaining oil. Add steak and sear until evenly browned on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
recipeInstructions.name: Place skillet back over heat and add remaining oil. Add steak and sear until evenly browned on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 4
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 4: Place skillet back over heat and add remaining oil. Add steak and sear until evenly browned on both sides, 1 to 2 minutes per side.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour sauce back into skillet and toss together with meat. Allow sauce to thicken, 1 to 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour sauce back into skillet and toss together with meat. Allow sauce to thicken, 1 to 2 minutes.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 5
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 5: Pour sauce back into skillet and toss together with meat. Allow sauce to thicken, 1 to 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss in green onion and continue to cook for 1 more minute until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss in green onion and continue to cook for 1 more minute until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 6
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 6: Toss in green onion and continue to cook for 1 more minute until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour Mongolian beef over steamed rice and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour Mongolian beef over steamed rice and serve.

video.name: Mongolian Beef Recipe Step 7
video.description:
How to make Mongolian Beef. 

Step 7: Pour Mongolian beef over steamed rice and serve.
